level.heading: FAILURE TO REQUEST A HEARING OR FAILURE TO APPEAR (§ 17-3126)

level.text: 3126.1 If a respondent who was sent a notice of a proposed action pursuant toection 3125 does not mail or deliver a request for a hearing within the timend in the manner required under that section, the Director may, without aearing, take the action proposed in the notice.

3126.2 If a respondent scheduled for a hearing does not appear for the hearingnd no continuance has been granted, the Director may conduct a hearing in theespondent’s absence and render a decision on the basis of the evidence beforehe Director. However, the Director, prior to rendering a decision, may, uponritten request of the respondent and payment of the required fee, send a copyf the transcript or summary of the hearing to the respondent and requestroposed findings of fact and conclusions of law from the respondent.
3126.3 The Director shall inform the parties of an action taken under thisection.
Source: Final Rulemaking published at 39 DCR 7853, 7867 (October 23, 1992).
